title: US Mortgage Rates Soar Past 7% for the First Time Since 2002
description: The average rate on 30-year mortgages — the most popular kind among Americans — rose to the highest level since 2002, tracking the Federal Reserve’s aggressive campaign of rate increases.
dc:creator: Tara Siegel Bernard
category: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
media:credit: Philip Cheung for The New York Times
media:description: Rates on 30-year fixed-rate mortgages, the most popular kind among U.S. home buyers, rose to 7.08 percent on Thursday.
